page.title: 04The Brush Factory,Combwich.
page.content: In Combwich there is a small factory that makes{brushes,}employing 10 people,who work from 8-0 clock to 12.30 and 1.15 to 4.45 on weekdays.The building used to be an old mill,it became a brush factory in{1948. { } To make brushes,{Timber, Bahia, {Animals Hair,Man made fibres and nylon are used. Stages of making a Brush. 1. Wood sawn to shape. 2. Holes drilled into the wood. 3. Bristles put in holes. 4. Wood sanded and varnished. The factory makes all kinds of{Brushes from the smallest, a typewriter cleaning brush to the largest,round hard brushes for a mechanical road sweeper.One unusual brush measuring 3 feet by 11 inches was fitted in a hotel shower room in Cornwall to scrub your back whilst having a shower.
